Mr. Villa de Melo, August 11, 1841

Sir

I have received your very esteemed letter dated the 6th of this month, and in responding to the Minister, I cannot help but tell him that, pleased by the honorable expressions of friendship with which the Minister has treated me even before knowing me, I must tell the Minister that here or at any post he can count on the friendship of a very republican Oriental.

Regarding the horse that the Minister mentioned to me, you can be sure that I will look for it and send it to you as soon as possible.

Without further ado, send with the frankness you wish to your friend and Yours faithfully and well informed, Manuel de Aleman

Answered on August 19, 1841.
